text:
This is a 75 year old with a  history  of Severe HTN, CAD, spinal
   stenosis, Hypothyroid, OA, Scoliosis, Diverticulitis, Hiatal Hernia, L
   shoulder injury, L knee torn cartilage, r Knee tumor, psoriasis, TIA,
   CRI, CABG x4 and MVR, B/L cataract, R Knee tumor resection, PTCA and
   Stent x2. She was admitted on the [**1-6**] for pre angio hydration  On [**1-7**]
   She underwent an angiogram of bilateral lower extremities, Abdominal
   Aortogram and Stenting of right common iliac artery stenosis and right
   external iliac artery stenosis. Around 1730 yesterday she developed a
   severe headache along with word finding and memory difficulties
   daughter felt she had some left sided weakness and facial weakness. Of
   note her blood pressure was 220
s Then episode lasted up to 45 minutes
   pt was sent for a head CT which was negative but blood pressure
   remained out of control so she was transferred to CVICU for a labetolol
   drip.
   Peripheral vascular disease (PVD) with critical limb ischemia
   Assessment:
   Alert and oriented X3.  Speech clear and normal. Moves all extremities
   with good strength.  L upper arm slightly weak r/t prior L shoulder
   injury.
   Follows commands. Continues to c/o frontal headache-treated with
   Tylenol, cold compresses and ice packs with slight relief.
   50-60 SB without VEA.  SBP 150-160
s/ On heparin gtt at 500 units/hr
   for PTT >150.  Pedal pulses by doppler,  feet warm and dry.
   Abdomen soft, ND.  Tolerating clears. No N/V.
   Voiding Q shift.  Creat 1.7
   R Fem with DSD CDI.
   Pt has abrasion R buttocks, mepilex applied.  Excoriation in L groin (?
   from OR shaving)
   Action:
   Oral antihypertensives medications restarted.   Continues on po
   labetalol.  Medications timed per pt
s home regimen.
   Last dose of mucomyst given 8am.
   K of 3.3 repleted with 40 meq oral KCL
   IVF dc
d, diet advanced to regular.
   Response:
   Hemodynamically stable.
   Plan:
Per Dr [**Last Name (STitle) **] OR note-The patient will need a left femoral
endarterectomy and a left femoral to below-knee popliteal
artery bypass for her tissue loss and rest pain. On the right
side should she develop worsening of her symptoms she would
need a right common femoral endarterectomy and possibly a
right femoral to above-knee popliteal artery bypass should
   her symptoms get worse. Pt also told this am she would need Carotid
   surgery prior to above. Goal SBP 140
